decision_conditions: Compliance with the five standard conditions as defined in regulation 2(1) and set out in schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning: (Control of Advertisements) (England) Regulations 2007
The maximum luminance of the proposed static illuminated free-standing/side wall signage on the submitted drawings hereby permitted shall not exceed 200 cd/m2.

To comply with the recommendations of the Institute of Public Lighting Engineers Technical Report No. 5 (Third Edition) in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with the Havering Local Plan Policy 13.
The maximum luminance of the proposed static illuminated fascia signage on the submitted drawings hereby permitted shall not exceed 200 cd/m2.

To comply with the recommendations of the Institute of Public Lighting Engineers Technical Report No. 5 (Third Edition) in the interests of amenity, and in order that the development accords with the Havering Local Plan Policy 13.
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
The applicant and designer must ensure that the illumination of the sign is within acceptable safe limits so not to impact on highway safety or neighbouring amenity.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
description: x1 fixed illuminated fascia sign, and x1 side wall signage
